channel.title: iTunes Situation
channel.description:
What I want done: Get my neightbors songs from his iTunes onto my iTunes
He has a mac and I have a pc
Is it possible for him to put his songs ont oa dvd/flashdrive/whatever so it can be put onto my iTunes? Ive heard from soem people that it can't be done but ive heard from others that it can, so idk.
I know I can easily get his songs onto my ipod, and plug that into my comp, but it wont let me put those songs from my ipod onto the itunes library, this is not what I want, i want it to always be on my itunes.
So anyone how if this can be done because we both like the same musi and I dont want to pay like $400 for songs whe nhe already has all of them.

item.title: iTunes Situation
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Yes, he did buy a lot of his songs from iTunes lol

Read full topic

item.title: iTunes Situation
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

If he downloaded his songs off iTunes store, then I think they are hidden. And hes stupid for buying music off iTunes.

And copypod allows you to rip songs off your iPod as if it were a CD.

CopyTrans

Home

Get CopyTrans to transfer iPod and iPhone music to PC and iTunes. Use CopyTrans Contacts to easily manage iPhone contacts, calendars and more...

Let him bring his iPod over and upload all his songs to your hard drive.
(that would be uploading. Not downloading :P)

Read full topic

item.title: iTunes Situation
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

@exps35, I thought they made it so that you can’t access the songs though, so how would an mp3 converter work? I could be wrong though, I haven’t tried.

@Bang Train, what does copypod do? take songs off of the ipod so they can be used with other programs?

Read full topic

item.title: iTunes Situation
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

if u can put on ipod, use an ipod back up program. I recommend copypod

Read full topic

item.title: iTunes Situation
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Well, If he has the mp3 files, you can put those directly onto any form of data transfer, and get those straight to your computer.

If they are iTunes format (or whatever the hell apple uses), then maybe put them through a media converter to mp3 format?

Just an idea. Just start trying stuff out. You’ll eventually come across something that works for you.

Read full topic
